website_summaries.verdict: A less expensive starter kit than our top pick, since it only includes two smart bulbs. Has many great features. Suitable kit for those curious about smart lighting who aren't ready to outfit their entire home.
pros: Noticeably brighter than earlier generation bulbs
Can be dimmed even in non-dimmer sockets
With an app, bulbs can brighten or dim over time, like a sleep cycle
cons: Original kit only contains two bulbs, others must be purchased separately

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  Too bad only 840 lumen bulbs available for remote
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly "as advertised." Easy set up. Easy to control away from home with the app for my iPhone. Great for mimicking presence while out of town. You can set a schedule when you'll be out, and set the times to come on and off, while adding some random change to the times. My only "complaint" would be that I wish they offered higher output bulbs, like 75w equivalent or 100w equivalent, and not just 60w equivalent (840 lumens).
customer_reviews.author: JMN

customer_reviews.title: Forced to upgrade, glad to find a great "Used - Like New" kit for reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Everything was included and packaged professionally. Could hardly tell it was used. I have used the original Hue Bridge 1 and Lux bulbs for years. Voice control is huge for how my home is set up, so I've literally been in the dark since the OG Bridge was discontinued. Was nice to find this reasonably priced Bridge 2 kit, and to discover these A19 bulbs get brighter than the old "Sultan" Lux bulbs I have. Glad to be back in business and have brighter bulbs. Philips better not discontinue this bridge now anytime soon!
customer_reviews.author: JocelynS

customer_reviews.title: Great product until it breaks
customer_reviews.text: Love this product its easy to set up - initially. However if your breaks setting up a new hub is an entirely new story. First you need to go online - deregister your old hub and register your new hub. Once that is done you have to manually enter the S/N for every light your old hub controlled, it will not detect them. The S/N is on the base of the bulb itself. If you have some in the ceiling where you need a ladder I recommend you keep a list of all the S/Ns or you'll find yourself climbing a ladder like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: While it WORKS sorta...
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend. I have worked with this for almost 2 years. Many disconnects and restarts. The problem I have has developed over time. Wifi and Zigbee are really the same kind of service over 2.4ghz. Eventually the more 2.4gnz systems I utilize they clash. I would recommend going for NO HUB REQUIRED lights. I particularly like Smart LIfe systems and Alexa direct connection devices. Another note the more systems you have, you may eventually want a MESH network in the home. They both (Smart Life and Alexa) have a lot of brands that are supported.
customer_reviews.author: Valiant K.

customer_reviews.title: Alsolutly NO SUPPORT , You are on you own
customer_reviews.text: The hub looses connection. (About 30 times a year that I have noticed) . But a reboot of the hub and it comes back. I bought a second HUB for my cabin .. Well you can't have 2 .. the APP wants you to DELETE THE OTHER HUB. !!! (OMG who programmed the app) (Migrate to the new HUB) Contacted Support a MONTH AGO still no answer. (Other then the ATUOMATED 'THANKS FOR CONTACTING US.. ) ,, While the one support person (Who just answers phone calls) is laughing hystericaly while reading support email from customers,, "They think we're going to answer them ,, Ha Ha HAAA".
customer_reviews.author: Mark Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Works but ........
customer_reviews.text: Because Philips wants to charge people for expensive light bulbs they stopped making this compatible with other smart bulbs. I would not recommend that anyone I know purchase this.
customer_reviews.author: drawde mahgninnuc

customer_reviews.title: Had to update the old hub to this new one
customer_reviews.text: so I got notices that my stuff would stop working if I didn't replace my generation 1 hub. Installing this per instructions seemed to work fairly smooth though the process of removing all of the lights from the old hub and adding them to the new could have been smoother. The bundle deal with the bulbs was better than just buying the hub so I got that even though I had no immediate plan for the bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: TX gadget nutTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Works well with easy setup!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to splurge on these because they got consistently good reviews and I didn't want to end up spending more on replacing an inferior product. I'm not sure what sort of qualms I would've run into with the cheaper products if any, but I really like this one! Setup was easy and the bulbs are a nice warm color. One thing I don't think I realized was that it requires a direct ethernet connection to your router. This is significant for me because my wifi is through an AT&T hotspot device and only allows one, but probably doesn't affect other people with multiple ports in a router.
customer_reviews.author: Alex M

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects from WiFi all the time!
customer_reviews.text: This thing constantly disconnects from wi fi and I have to re-do everything over again and again. So it’s pretty useless in my eyes. I don’t have time to hover over it.
customer_reviews.author: Irina

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sweet for the price!
customer_reviews.text: So far this came in, the setup was pretty easy, (honestly I feel like a toddler can do it) 800 lumen dimmable (only through the app don’t use an actual dimming switch with supplied bulbs). I like it so far, haven’t had any issues yet, update speeds for the bulbs could be improved (I think that’s just my preference) but yes I do recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nextarkid122

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit because you don't have to use Alexa or any of the other systems. I have it setup on my phone with the Hue app and it does exactly what I want. It gives me the ability to dim any light that I have the bulb installed in. The app gives me as much or more features that I want.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Worked ok until...
customer_reviews.text: After a moderately complicated setup process, the Hue lights worked good to great. The ability to dim lights and turn lights on and off around the house without having to walk up and down stairs was great. Being able to control them when not home was great. Then one day, it stopped working. Tried to trouble shoot it- my best guess is the bridge just stopped working. It won't connect to anything. And just like that, it's spend another 50$ or just turn the lights on and off the old fashioned way or have to start an app
customer_reviews.author: William Nichols-Klaff

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Working great so far! I was not aware you needed to plug the cable into your modem directly and my modem is located in my living room while these are for my bedroom so I was worried that there might be a connection issue but, nope! Works great with my Echo all the way in my bedroom. Philips has a great set up app and easy to use as well.
customer_reviews.author: JML

customer_reviews.title: The bulbs work very well and easy set up!
customer_reviews.text: I have these and I also purchased them for my in laws. I love these bulbs. I have them integrated with my Google home and they work very well. I enjoy being able to dim them at night and not having to have to worry about turning lights on and off, especially before bed. They are nice for mood lighting and regular use. They are easy to set up with your wifi and the app is super easy to use as well. Totally worth it for your smart home!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: dead within a year
customer_reviews.text: The Hue bridge won't connect and there are literally no workarounds I haven't tried. Unfortunately, I now have a bunch of overprice lightbulbs with no choice but to re-purchase the bridge if I want to get them to work. I really wish I'd used another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Homeschool Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good product but had some trouble installing it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product as a Christmas gift for my father. My father is not the most tech savvy but I didn't expect this to be a problem since in my experience Echo products have been extremely simple to install and use. However this one had some issues. We experienced some problems when pairing the Hue to the Echo. There was some weird error in the Alexa mobile app when downloading the skill. After an hour trying to figure this out I put my hands up in defeat in hopes of the developers fixing this issue before I tackle it again the next day. Lo and behold the next day it worked!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Luong

customer_reviews.title: One of my best buys
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought the wrong color of light but other than that it works exactly as advertised. Love the ability to turn lights on in the house even when I'm away so I never have to come home to an unlit house. It works even better when I'm feeling lazy in bed and don't feel to move but want to turn on a light in a room Synced with app fine and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Nn

customer_reviews.title: Back to Illumi
customer_reviews.text: I give up. It's back to Illumi for me. The Philips Hue system is completely unusable for me. Mainly because the app is terrible. Either there's no way to adjust the brightness or that particular feature is really well hidden. But, there are lots of other 3rd party apps out there. Some of them are free. I tried 3 or 4 and just couldn't make it work for me. I had really high hopes of taking things to the next level with the Hue system but sadly it was just a waste of money. :(
customer_reviews.author: shiver

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS PRODUCT! I got this for my parents as a Christmas gift. I set it up for them and it was super easy. It took maybe five minutes. I also paired it to the echo dot i got them and that took about another ten because i had to create a philips account to sign in on the Alexa app. If you don’t want to connect it to an amazon echo product then you don’t have to set up and account. You can just download the app and name your house and each of your rooms and boom you’re done. I love it so much i am getting them for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to my home. I need more!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these with an echo dot. I wanted the dot specially for these bulbs. I am not let down. The pairing instructions weren't super easy to navigate. And I wasn't aware the hub has to be plugged directly to the router, but I got everthing set up with a little patience. Can't wait to buy more bulbs for other rooms. Easy to use once set up. It's so much easier to turn on the lights in the living room since I don't have any overhead lighting. I only have lamps. I can turn everything on at once. I can dim them. Or I can turn on individual lamps with my voice or with my phone. Love them!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sunrise alarm is not a true sunrise alarm.
customer_reviews.text: A sunrise alarm should start from total darkness and slowly get brighter from there. The main reason I got the hue system was for a sunrise alarm. It doesn't start form total darkness, it turns on to a low light setting abruptly, I'd guess about 10 %, and then gets brighter. Its bright enough and aburpt enough at the start that I wake up abruptly, which I hate. you can make the white lights warm or cool either. And the hub takes up another outlet and has to be plugged directly into the router.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Easy and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Works well and easy setup, but if you add extra bulbs that don't come with the startup kit you need to make it go out and discover the other bulbs before you can control them. Took me a couple of minutes to find that feature on the app, but was not a big deal. Works well with the Echo. Don't know why so many complain about the app. I am using it on IOS and it does what it needs to do and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: E. Gehr

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Alexa, unless the internet is out
customer_reviews.text: This works great with Alexa most of the time. Obviously, if the internet is out, it's not going to work because Alexa is not going to work. Sometimes Alexa says she cannot contact The Hub. I ignore her and simply ask again. This has always worked. As long as Alexa is working, it will work the second time. She will turn the light on and off, change its brightness , Etc. This was the Kit with the White lights only, but if you have the color lights, she will change the color also. Pretty cool if you ask me.
customer_reviews.author: Yo Mama

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth getting the hue
customer_reviews.text: Love these lights! You are getting the quality of a Phillips bulb with the technology of Alexa. Having to find a spot for the hue isn’t ideal but once you have one you can attach as many bulbs to it as you want. Having the hue definitely helps them to operate better than the hueless bulbs. Bulbs can be adjusted to different brightness levels and can be controlled with Alexa. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Berke

customer_reviews.title: Product description inaccurate - internet connection is absolutely necessary
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after researching it thoroughly and learning in the product descriptions that an internet connection is not required for it to function properly. It worked well, connected to a WiFi router for a little over a month, but then the app said that the Bridge needed to be updated, which requires the router to be connected to the internet. The whole system doesn’t work now and won’t until I update the Bridge. I feel that Philips should either change their product description to say that an internet connection is absolutely necessary or let us use the Bridge with the older software.
customer_reviews.author: StudentMom

customer_reviews.title: Good choince for smart lights if using Alexa
customer_reviews.text: These worked well - I was concerned about adding a hub that would have to communicate with Alexa, but the setup was easy. I was also concerned that the commands would be convoluted. They were not. Some devices have instructions like, "Alexa, tell Acmehub to turn on hallway lights" - it's not like that. The command is "Alexa, turn on hallway lights." I was pleased to see that no other dimmer device is required. I presumed incorrectly that I would need the Phillips Hue dimmer. But Alexa does it without a separate dimmer: Just say, "Alexa, dim hallway lights"
customer_reviews.author: JOHN G WILKINSON

customer_reviews.title: I Feel Lazier Already!
customer_reviews.text: I will admit, I was a skeptic of the whole "smart home" thing. I've had a google home for a while now and never really used it to it's full potential. With this kit though, I took large step towards achieving that. Set up for this only took about 25 mins and then google was turning on/off my lights whenever I asked. The app for your phone is great and easy to use. You can also add several other lights after you set this up. I have it controlling my living room lights and my bedroom lights.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C.

customer_reviews.title: I love this on
customer_reviews.text: Two years later. My review stands. These lights are great. I haven't had to replace either of the two I purchased. I purchased this set of lights after a couple of failed attempts with other lights. I love this on. It works almost every time. And the few instances that it does not work I simply repeat the command to Alexa and it works. Not sure whether it's an Alexa issue or hub issue, which ever it doesn't happen frequently enough to matter. Will definitely purchase more lights as the need arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Total control over the lights.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set of Philips Hue lights I buy. I love the control I get with them, whether using the Philips Hue App, Alexa or Siri, I can control each independent bulb, the light intensity, etc. One thing to mention, these are NOT white as the name indicates. These are yellowish lights. If you want a white light (or something closer looking to a true white) you'll need the color bulb which can be adjusted to white. Other than this, I love everything about them.
customer_reviews.author: Yass

customer_reviews.title: SAD
customer_reviews.text: Highly disappointed when I got these to my house and found out they will refurbish lights I'm thinking all this money that I paid for these light 💡 Why did I get brand new once and then not even white their yellow let me find out how to find I can send them back and get some brand new ones that are white
customer_reviews.author: La Donna

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but don't be misled
customer_reviews.text: I love these lights. However, just be aware that the hub is NOT wireless. I feel the description is misleading, because they mention connecting it to WiFi. What you end up finding out is that their version of WiFi is you connecting the hub by a cable to a WiFi router. Duh! Anything connected to a WiFi router can be accessed wirelessly. If it was more descriptive about this fact, it would have 5 stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: The Ryan

customer_reviews.title: I really like the hue system, I just want them to last longer than 4000 hrs
customer_reviews.text: I bought 5 bulbs (a mixture of White Ambiance, and White A19 bulbs) and 2 of them failed before the 2 year mark. I used it a lot, about 7-8 hours a day (slowly turn on in the morning until I left for work, and on at sunset until I went to bed). It turns out the warranty is only good for 3285 hours. To be fair the other bulbs continue to work fine, but I expected an expensive bulb like this to last longer than 3285 hrs. Really I like the Hue system, but not the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Tom G

customer_reviews.title: Great for forgetful people
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this product. While I do think they're overpriced, they should hopefully last for multiple years. Having two kids, it makes it easier to turn the lights off when taking them to bed, because I can just ask our Google mini to. It's also helpful if me or my husband forgets to turn lights off at the house because we can do it with an app.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Bragg

customer_reviews.title: Awesome system if you take time to learn it.
customer_reviews.text: I can see why people rave about this device. This whole kit makes being lazy easier and the same time makes you feel safe if your not home or will be arriving home late or will be on vacation away from your house. I can also see it being beneficial for individuals who may be handicapped or have a physical ailment or be for a senior citizen. Just set the device up with an Alexa, google device and then teach individual to use the system.
customer_reviews.author: Andy C.

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: I love the audibly controlled lights. Via Alexa, my mother has the safety of being able to turn lights off/on without traversing any area in the dark. Many additional convenience aspects, but for safety it can't be beat. That said, it doesn't always recognize the command or think the light is connected to the network. Sometimes it takes 3-4 attempts, but with persistence it always works. I also put a bulb in a dimmable lamp. It would flicker on the dim setting, and burned out in 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Rurdy4this

customer_reviews.title: Definitely NOT white
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bulbs hoping for white light and in the description it indeed said white. But to my surprise, it was the color of the bulbs, not the light itself. Bought a 2-pack and they work perfectly with Alexa and my Google Home, but I just can't stand yellow light. Unclear advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel G

customer_reviews.title: These are a game changer!
customer_reviews.text: I have a newborn baby so having these lights is a lifesaver. When I have my hands full or I’m holding her it’s hard to simply turn the lights on or off especially if I’m putting her to sleep so to have Alexa do it is so convenient. Sometimes I even use my phone they work with iPhones. I want to get four more bulbs and make my entire house smart LOL what was I doing with my life before these.
customer_reviews.author: Angie J.

customer_reviews.title: Great Bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I love these bulbs! I want to get more and set them up all over the house. Alexa was a bit of a struggle to set up. I think it was because I had never done so before. Once I got the hang of it, it was fine. I love the dimmer function. It's really great in the morning when I don't want the entirety of a extremely bright light in my eyes, but need some light.
customer_reviews.author: Howling Scribe

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup works great with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: This kit is easy to setup and does exactly what I expected. I recently got an echo dot as well and it integrates perfectly with these bulbs. I can now control my lights hands free, with my phone, and even when I am not at home. My phone does occasionally have a delay connecting when I come home but with the dot I can still easily control my lights. They are also a bit pricey when you have fixtures with multiple bulbs. My favorite part is not having to get out of bed to turn the lights off at night.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to play with the Hue to see if I want to go on the IoT enabled lights journey. My original hope was to meet the current need to have my exterior lights turn on and off based on time of day. While this particular solution is not appropriate for that, I did set it up for a couple lights in the house and it was easy to do. I am likely to get a few more Phillips Hue lights...
customer_reviews.author: A. B. Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Good starter pack if you don’t already have a smart home Hub.
customer_reviews.text: Already had philips hue white and RGB lights installed and working with Alexa. Got the Philips Hub to try the lights with the Hue App. Problem was the lights I already had worked with the Philips Hub and Alexa Echo Hub. But the lights that came with the PhilipsHub won’t work with the Alexa Hub. Not a huge deal but made me aware there are some models of Philips Hue lights that aren’t compatible with the Alexa Hub.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing when paired with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned the items for some time and they work good together with the Echo Dot. There are times when I have to repeat “echo turn on lights”. I wish it was more intuitive but understand for the price that it’s quite an amazing step in the right direction. I will be investing in more lights to connect.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony P

customer_reviews.title: I love this--Just watch out on any additional bulbs you might ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this--Just watch out on any additional bulbs you might be purchasing MAKE SURE THEY ARE "HUE" not just Philips. I did the "what others are purchasing and got 6 bulbs that don't work :-(
customer_reviews.author: Suki Doo

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and works well with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation and works well with Alexa. You need the hub to connect to the bulbs either from mobile app or Alexa. I later find out there are bulbs can connect to Alexa or mobile app, such as bulbs from Tuya Smart. The home automation devices will get smarter and cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: K. Chen

customer_reviews.title: CANNOT SET DEFAULT COLOR
customer_reviews.text: I am keeping this a 1 star until they get something fixed: the ability to set a default color when turned on. I like my daylight (6500k) color but when you set up wake up timers, it switches back to the warm light. WHO WAKES UP TO WARM YELLOWISH LIGHT???? We need the BLUE light to get us up. Stupid. Philips, your a big company so you should have included this in your app; what is your excuse?!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally a Clap-On/Clap-Off for the person who needs extra hands!
customer_reviews.text: I paired these with my Alexa and it's made life so much simpler - especially when I am in a rush out the door or have my hands full at night when going upstairs to bed with a puppy, water and whatever else I am juggling to carry! I put them in my living room lamps and they are the perfect brightness level for this. I recently went on a business trip and easily set up timings to make my house look occupied! Easy setup and no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Allison Wells

customer_reviews.title: This is very useful for vacation mode as it gives the appearance of ...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly and the recent update provides "random" auto on instead set time on and off. This is very useful for vacation mode as it gives the appearance of someone being home.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I’ve not even had these light bulbs for 24 hours, and my life is already so much more comfortable. From turning off my custom reading light without getting out of bed at night to waking up to a gently increasing light in the morning, I don’t think I will be turning back.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: I’m in LOVE with these bulbs and my boyfriend keeps making fun ...
customer_reviews.text: My life is forever changed. I’m in LOVE with these bulbs and my boyfriend keeps making fun of how I’m nerding out over how many different combos etc I can set for mood and functionality. I literally have a routine in which I tell Alexa(which you can link up separately) “I have to pee” and a little night light will come on in the bathroom for those times at night where you would usually have to stumble around in the dark. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Crayton

customer_reviews.title: I truly regret buying this
customer_reviews.text: After just a few months of working correctly, one lightbulb died and the other is unresponsive to the app. Resetting and reinstalling everything (hue, lights, app) has not helped. Do not buy this kit
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great bulb.
customer_reviews.text: Using these in our driveway light fixtures. They are a lot brighter than I expected and I am loving being able to have them on our smart home! I needed to update the bridge and this was a great way to do that.
customer_reviews.author: D L Roach III

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and use with mobile app
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. My son is afraid of the dark so we got him this. He LOVES it. Got can set the lights to go on and off at certain times or via voice commands. Even has a night lite mode. Now he can tell his echo from downstairs to turn on the hall light when we get home. No one is scared to go upstairs by themselves any more. Just wish it came with 1-2 more bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Great App
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing a smart light system, I first checked out the corresponding app in the App Store. The Phillip’s Hue app was the only one with great ratings. That’s why I decided to purchase this. It was easy to setup and is very enjoyable to use. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Greg L. Christian

customer_reviews.title: Philips Hue - where have you been my whole life!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to go fully automatic in my home. I was on the fence for years and my home is very large. I have these in every room and all set on a schedule. This system never disappoints. I especially love my away presets, no more worries when I go traveling. LOVE!
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: So glad i bought these!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife with her echo dot and we love it!!! It's nice being able to turn your lights on/off even when you're away from home. Coming home late, i can open the app and turn any of the lights on and not have to come into a pitch black house. If you have any interest in a smart home, these are great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sour

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Augmented Reality app
customer_reviews.text: I am already using other solutions so this was my experiment. Setup was very easy and once I got everything working with Hue lights app, I did the setup with Augmented Reality app. I can now control lights with augmented reality by looking at them, it's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Jacek

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: This was my introduction into smart house devices and I love it! I was pleased with how easy it was to set up and I can't wait to get more in my house. Being able to dim at any time is great, it also gets very bright at 100%, more so than regular lights do, this is highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Schobelock

customer_reviews.title: An essential for smart home living
customer_reviews.text: Man I've been missing out on so much. These made life so much easier. Being a new dad and all with a new born and now having a fully advanced smart home. These are like a must have. No issues with installation or item working properly at all. These are solid!
customer_reviews.author: Chad H Worthman

customer_reviews.title: Some will last and some won't
customer_reviews.text: I love the lights. They work well with the app. Only down side is one light has already died. It didn't last as long as they exclaimed and you can't get a replacement. Which I think they should since it's not cheap.
customer_reviews.author: ICB

customer_reviews.title: On, Off, Dim, Brighten... and No Clapping!
customer_reviews.text: I do love just telling the light when to come on or turn off, as well as what % to dim or brighten... that said, I do wish these bulbs came in maybe 100 or at least 75 watt size... 60 isn't that bright. It was pretty easy to set up the bridge & the bulbs, along with the app on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Auntie Blues

customer_reviews.title: Philips Hue starter kit
customer_reviews.text: Everything came in one box and was on time the quality of the Hub is great nice white would like a black the connection with Alex is good just a small learning curve the brightness of the bulb is brighter then I expected I'm telling all my friend to up grade the this
customer_reviews.author: kim l fry

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Google Assistant
customer_reviews.text: If Phillips would stop updating there software, a simple product like this would be a breeze to setup. Every so often a new SW update is forced on me and then I get to start over with my setup. Each time it worked fine before the update, so I am not sure why an update is forced on me.
customer_reviews.author: GDG

customer_reviews.title: Please respond if can just send that part.. thanks! Susan
customer_reviews.text: We are missing the actual plug part that goes into the box that goes into the outlet... our pic is the first and showing what seems like is supposed to be included..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Read a lot of reviews that said these were hard to set up and difficult to connect to Alexa. We’ve been crazy happy with them. Easy set-up. Work well. While syncing with Alexa did take a bit of effort, we did figure it out. We have also been able to control while away from the house..out of state even. Love them and can’t wait to get more!
customer_reviews.author: Christine M Kimble

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for dead hub
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace a hub that quit working. It was a bit of an adventure figuring out how to reassign the bulbs to the new hub. Once I found instructions on the internet it was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: These work well and I like having the ability to use with the Echo
customer_reviews.text: These work well and I like having the ability to use with the Echo. Waiting for a discount/or price to come down for the 4 so I can put them in a few more strategic places. My timer on my lamp is no longer working for some reason, so purchased this to replace and nice to be able to use Alexa when not at home to change up the lights going off and on.
customer_reviews.author: D. Guthrie

customer_reviews.title: Great bulbs!
customer_reviews.text: I got this with my amazon echo 3rd gen as a package deal and it works flawlessly! It wakes me up at 6am each and every day! This does not change colors but I only needed this product to mimic the sunlight since my room is in the basement! These bulbs are very yellow and bright!
customer_reviews.author: Elvis

customer_reviews.title: Works well but be careful of range.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the hub with the two bulbs. The setup was easy as suggested and the bulbs work well. I have then setup with Apple HomeKit and Apple TV which work well most of the time. I think the one bulb might be a little out of range and I often get a no response from the bulb. The idea of being able to extend the range by having multiple devices dosent seem to hold true they need to be close to the hub no more than 30ft away.
customer_reviews.author: Samolwar

customer_reviews.title: “Routines” function does not work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could use the routines function in my bedrooms. I’ve installed everything and the routines don’t work. I’m VERY unhappy. It’s also past the return date so I can’t send it back to Amazon (my fault.) I reached out to Phillips and I hope they can help bc I cannot find any advice online.
customer_reviews.author: HPH

customer_reviews.title: doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: 1/2 the time. mostly it can’t connect to work-fi and just spins. other times it connects just fine but not dependable. would buy the Idevices instead.
customer_reviews.author: Pro Makeup Artist4Life

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly. Very simple and easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my grandparents who vacation a lot and they like to turn the lights on and off when they’re away to make it look like someone is home. The setup was so easy. I had everything set up for them in under five minutes and it’s very easy to control. They love it.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella

customer_reviews.title: Alexa, lights on! Voila!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for home....works great with Alexa and phone integration. Detects when I'm close by the house and turns on the lights for me so I don't walk into a dark home. Fantastic starter kit!
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I love the light bulbs! The location setting, they turn on when you arrive home based on the location on your phone is amazing. There are other brands that I’m sure are cheaper and are the sameness but I got this in a bundle with echo dot so the price wasn’t as bad.
customer_reviews.author: Alondra Del Hierro

customer_reviews.title: Super useful
customer_reviews.text: I love this product so much, I bought 2 more as gifts. It’s so nice to be able to easily have the bedroom lights dimmed or shut off without getting out of bed. I’m putting one on my front porch so that I can turn on the light when i get home. It’s really nice to be able to program it with Alexa and use as a routine. So when I saw good morning, my kitchen light comes on.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Not working as I envisioned.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in additon a previously purchased bridge only to discover that the bulbs provided with this bridge are not recognized by the older bridge already in service. Still having issues with this system being compatible with Google Assistant. The system works fine as a stand alone.
customer_reviews.author: Don O

customer_reviews.title: Not white but yellow
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using daylight lightbulbs since their creation. This Hue light bulb has a warm yellow tone, and isn’t as bright as my daylight lights. Otherwise the product is great. The other downside is the hub needs to connect to both your WiFi router and power source, but both cables provided are a bit short given where my router and power supply are located.
customer_reviews.author: grayellow

customer_reviews.title: NOT the colored lights
customer_reviews.text: These are great, you can download the app and control it from your phone. I guess I didn't read the description well enough because I was expecting these to be the ones you can pick any color light, but it is only white lights.
customer_reviews.author: Delaney

customer_reviews.title: . Very glad to make this purchase. Also easy to use from the Hue app if you dont have an Echo product
customer_reviews.text: I really want to knock a star off because the Phillips Hue app and website suck badly...not epically, but badly. Once you navigate their weirdness and glitches and sync it with Echo (not required) it works like a charm. Very glad to make this purchase. Also easy to use from the Hue app if you dont have an Echo product
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C.

customer_reviews.title: The 2 bulbs won't connect but my other 8 do.
customer_reviews.text: So I already have 8 bulbs but I got this to set up a hub. All my 8 bulbs connect no issue. These 2 do not. No idea why.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use smart light bulbs
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs work great! It comes with the hub to set it up and it's pretty easy to get working. The bulbs have a dimmer in them so you can tell Alexa to dim the lights to whatever brightness you want. The nightlight setting is nice for when you just want enough light to get around the room at night. I plan on purchasing more for other rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene Falk

customer_reviews.title: No need to get up and turn off the light
customer_reviews.text: I'm one of those people that leave the lights on until right before I get tired enough to fall asleep. It used to annoy me that I would have to get up from a comfortable position to turn off the light and then get comfortable again. Now I can ask Alexa to turn off the lights for me or manage it via my phone. If you're a light sleeper like I am, I have Alexa use the light as an alarm and the alarm "goes off" by turning on the light which wakes me up instantly. It was scary at first but works every time lol.
customer_reviews.author: W.Marz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: The Phillips Hur bulbs are great for people with disabilities, frequent travelers, or if you just want convenience. We love the ability to turn them on and off via the phone and the dimming abilities. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Enkidu

customer_reviews.title: Great lights, they work wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Great lights , they work wonderful. I use the lights to have a 2ND switch for my basement to save me walking down the stairs to turn on desk light with the overhead on and not having to walk back up the stairs hall way to turn off overhead lights. cheaper than getting an electrician to add the extra light switches.
customer_reviews.author: steven n toomey

customer_reviews.title: Lights good hub bad
customer_reviews.text: Didn't need the hub, it actually causes interference with alexa. I have about 20 phillips hues lights and 3 amazon plugs. works great without the hub. the hub cant discover the lights. not real sure what the purpose of the hub is, its app isn't rated very high either.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: outlet connector missing
customer_reviews.text: Good thing I was replacing an existing unit. The KIT did not include any type of plug for the wall outlet.
customer_reviews.author: srq fl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lights that make it easy to get started!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these lights as a gift for my brother after owning them myself for about a year. They work great and integrate well with Alexa, Google Assistant, and Apple HomeKit.
customer_reviews.author: Noah LaRoy

customer_reviews.title: Sweet product. No problem setting up the bridge to ...
customer_reviews.text: Sweet product. No problem setting up the bridge to my router. Works like a charm no problem setting up with Alexa. I also bought the 4 pack to setup other rooms as well
customer_reviews.author: Thor4u2nv

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: Purchased them almost 2 years ago and it’s still going strong
customer_reviews.author: Christy Carter Austin

customer_reviews.title: lights on
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go with my Alexa and they work great. lights on lights off voice commands works good. also i can turn the lights off and of via app when i am not home great when the kids leave the house with a light on.
customer_reviews.author: JGoodyear

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup for nontech folks like me. I love being able to control warmth of the lights. Great with Alexa or with the app. One downside: unlike some other smart lights, these don’t allow me to override & use the switch to turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Installing and connecting to my home network was very easy. Voice control with alexa is easy or using app is also easy. I am going to be adding more lights very soon. The lights are not as bright as I would have liked.
customer_reviews.author: Reecee15x

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: . Have not tried motion detection Able to set up. Added security while I traveled, could set up times lights went on and off
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Great lights remember to name each so you can select which one come on. Easy to dime by voice.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Zeniecki

customer_reviews.title: I'm a happy little nerd
customer_reviews.text: Oh my this satisfies the nerd in me. I've got the hub linked so that I can operate the bulb in my bedroom with my Echo "Alexa, turn on my bedroom light." The other bulb is operated via the Hue app, I have it on a timer, called a routine. Makes me happy.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bruner

customer_reviews.title: Great smart home product
customer_reviews.text: Addicted to smart home products and this one is a great way to start. No more plug in night lights that my girls can tamper with. Now we just use the nightlight scene and they sleep well. In my opinion they aren't ideal to use all the time bc sometimes Alexa doesn't understand you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so far so great
customer_reviews.text: The setup is very easy, I did have a different set of bulbs from a different company and these are just so much better. So far I've not had any problems with it losing connection.
customer_reviews.author: Masta

customer_reviews.title: Helpful item
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and fun to use. Only thing I don't like is when the power goes out and comes back, the lights come on even though they were not turned on before the outage.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Great for setting custom light schedules & moods
customer_reviews.text: We use our white bulbs in tv room lamps. We added color bulbs to room and both options are fantastic. I like that we could set a wake up and sleep lights setting. We have a number of custom activity and mood settings for all bulbs. We will be adding more bulbs to rest of home soon. It was super easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: cc

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best thing since sliced bread. Seriously!!! We are seniors. We can ask Echo Dot to turn off of on lights for us. It helps in dark house at night, especially with 2 black cats coming to greet us.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Digit

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product - feeling my way through the technology but was easy for me to set up and use. It is a great way to have security lighting and easy to change.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy K. Rowland

product_meta.title: Philips Hue White A19 60W Equivalent Dimmable LED Smart Bulb Starter Kit (2 A19 60W White Bulbs and 1 Hub Compatible with Amazon Alexa Apple HomeKit and Google Assistant), 2 Pack
product_meta.description:
ABOUT HUE: Philips Hue is the World’s Leader in Smart Lighting.* Extend Smart Lighting throughout your home, including outdoor spaces, with the Philips Hue system. What is smart lighting you may ask? It means absolute control of your home's lighting through your smartphone, tablet, Hue wireless dimmer switches and sensors or even with your voice. As a bonus, Philips Hue is the only smart lighting product with Energy Star certification and lasts up to 22 years. GOT VOICE? Do you already have a favorite Voice or Smart Home assistant? With the most options for Voice control, Philips Hue Smart Light bulbs work with any Voice or Smart Home Assistant (Works with Alexa, Google Assistant, Apple HomeKit, Microsoft Cortana, IFTTT, Nest, Logitech, SmartThings, Razer, Xfinity). HOW IT WORKS: Hue smart light bulbs are wireless connected to the Hue Hub (included in Hue Starter Kits, also sold separately) using a technology called Zigbee. Thanks to this technology one bulb can transmit the signal also to other bulbs, so you don’t need to add a Wi-Fi extender to cover all the rooms in your house or clog up your Wi-Fi network with additional Wi-Fi devices. Add up to 50 light points on one Hue Hub.

* According to market share data from leading research bodies in US and Europe; these markets represent over 90% of global sales of both Philips Hue and the Smart Lighting industry.
feature_bullets: Works with Alexa for voice control (hub required and included, Alexa device sold separately).
Enhance your home with soft white lighting, controlled remotely wherever you are. Set timers and light schedules, automating your lights to make it seem like someone is home even when you are away.

Each kit contains 2 Philips Hue White A19 60W Energy Star Certified LED Smart bulbs (able to fit most lamps and overhead lights); Philips Hue Bridge that can reliably control up to 50 Hue lights without slowing your WiFi; three-year warrantee.

To install, simply screw in the smart bulbs into your desired light location, download the Hue mobile app and pair your Hue bridge. Control smart-bulb-equipped lamps and overhead lights via the Philips Hue App.

Easily expand your lighting system with accessories (sold separately), such as a Hue Dimmer Switch, Hue Tap, or Hue Motion Sensor. Pair it with your other Smart Home devices like Nest or SmartThings system.

specifications.Included Components: Philips Hue White A19 60W Equivalent Smart Bulb Starter Kit
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,360 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
